A point $ (x,y)$ in the plane is called a lattice point if both $ x$ and $ y$ are integers. The area of the largest square that contains exactly three lattice points in its interior is closest to\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 4.0\qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 4.2\qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 4.5\qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 5.0\qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 5.6$
